name: American Electric Power Company, Inc.
image_caption: [[AEP Building]], the company's headquarters in [[Columbus, Ohio]]
predecessor: Originally American Gas and Electric Company (AG&E), formed in 1906 from Electric Company of America.  Became American Electric Power in 1958; merged with Central and Southwest Corporation in 2000.
area_served: {{bulleted list|'''AEP Ohio''': [[Ohio]]|'''AEP Texas''': [[Texas]]|'''Appalachian Power''': [[Tennessee]], [[Virginia]], [[West Virginia]]|'''Indiana Michigan Power''': [[Indiana]], [[Michigan]]|'''Kentucky Power''': [[Kentucky]]|'''PSO''': [[Oklahoma]]|'''SWEPCO''': [[Arkansas]], [[Louisiana]], [[Texas]]}}
products: {{ubl|[[Electric power generation|Electricity generation]]|[[Electric power transmission]]|[[Electricity distribution]]}}
